lead_paragraph: Hackers stole data from computers at the French anti-doping lab where tests are being challenged by the American cyclist Floyd Landis, the police said yesterday. The Chatenay-Malabry laboratory, which is accredited by the International Olympic Committee and the World Anti-Doping Agency, analyzed the samples that indicated that Landis had elevated levels of testosterone in his system when he won the Tour de France in July.
